title: A while back you removed alistar's ability to autoattack after his knock back
body: Yet lee still can auto attack after his knock back and it is far more problematic since his autos hurt.

> [{quoted}](name=Lordnewb,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=E1whUoAA,comment-id=00070000,timestamp=2015-10-10T22:34:31.935+0000)

Do you not realize how stupid this sounds? You're comparing an ultimate to a basic ability. One has a cooldown of 10 seconds at max rank, on a champion who will build 40% CDR dropping it to 6 seconds and 650 range, the other is an ultimate with a 60 second cooldown with 375 range on a champion, that at most, will itemize 20-30% CDR, bringing it down to a 48-42 second cooldown. And if you want to talk about base damage and scaling, keep in mind Lee's ult scales with BONUS AD, not total AD. Alistars W has a 275 base damage max rank with 70% TOTAL AP scaling, meaning that if they both build heavy damage (Lee AD, Ali AP), they're both going to do roughly the same amount of damage. So even though it's a stupid comparison to make in an attempt at trying to bring Lee's ult into a bad light, in reality, you're making an argument that Ali's W is potentially even more broken. Nevermind the fact that if he could still AA immediately after W, with a lich bane proc, how much more damage Ali would end up doing.

Let's do some math crafting for this if we're going to be comparing hard values:
2 damage items (typical build), level 18

{{champion:12}} {{item:3027}} {{item:3100}} (lich bane is used because you are considering it for your argument)
Say, +25 AP from runes+masteries
Base Attack Damage: 123 AD
205 AP total
Headbutt damage: 418 damage
Lich bane damage: 195 on-hit damage
_**Total damage from Headbutt + Lich Bane proc + auto attack: 736 damage**_

{{champion:64}} {{item:3074}} {{item:3035}} 
Say, +20 AD from runes+masteries
Total Attack Damage: 251 AD (116 base + 135 bonus)
Dragon's Rage damage: 600 base + 270 bonus = 870 total damage
Auto attack damage: 251 damage
_**Total damage from Dragon's Rage + auto attack = 1,121 damage**_

Keep in mind that I'm making the argument **_against_** Lee Sin being allowed to auto attack after he ults, I'm **_not_** making the case for Alistar to get his auto attack after headbutt back. 

Hard number crunching, Lee Sin's ult+auto combo deals _**152% more**_ damage than Alistar's headbutt+auto combo. 

Now we also have to consider the context of how these knockback ability+auto combos operate in:
Alistar's combo makes use of his disengage but also a gap-closer. When Alistar does this combo, he has put his enemy at a distance away from him, denying him any further follow-up. Suppose he uses Pulverize before executing the combo, that tacks on an extra (240base+103bonus) = 343 damage
_**Q+lich bane auto+W+lich bane auto = 1151 total combo damage**_

When Lee Sin does this combo, most of the time, the target is tagged with a Sonic Wave before executing the combo, then Resonating Strike after the combo is performed. Suppose Lee Sin does this for his combo, that tacks on an extra (170base+121bonus) + (170base+121bonus+113missingHp) = 695 damage
_**Q1+Ult+auto+Q2 = 1816 total combo damage**_

The average non-tank support has 1800~base hp, +150 hp from Sightstone = 1950 hp (remember, 2 typical items, Sightstone is like the only early hp item that non-tank supports get)
The average marksman has 1950~base hp (hp items are not typical)

Alistar's optimal combo (essentially, his entire kits damage) deals _**59%**_ of the average Marksman's or non-tank Support's hp bar.

Lee Sin's combo deals _**94%**_ of the average Marksman's or non-tank Support's hp bar. And we're not even counting auto attacks he can string in there from using his Safeguard as a gap closer and using Tempest as another damage source.

Bottom fucking line, yes Alistar's combo will hurt like hell, _**but at least you can live from it and retaliate after it's over**_. 
With Lee Sin's combo, you're barely going to live, and _**one fuck-up after the combo is over will kill you.**_

Alistar may have been toxic with the mechanic, and thank god it was removed, but Lee Sin needs to fucking have it removed as well. It's a kick in the face (_haha_) for him to have this mechanic when his AD ratios are fucking absurd as they are. Yes, I do believe his AD ratios need to be nerfed too, but the first step should be in homogenizing knockback abilities and the inability to auto attack immediately after they are cast. The amount of times that I have played a squishy champion, been 30-40% hp, Lee Sin safeguards to a ward next to me, fails to kill me with his ult but the follow-up auto attack kills me...

Ali's also has range, Lee's is borderline melee. Fucking apples & oranges.

And it sounds like you didn't read mine either.

I am not saying literally ANYTHING about whether Lee has too much damage.

I AM saying there's VERY little difference between allowing Lee to AA after his ult and just giving him +100% base AD onto the ult's damage. It's a simple matter of numbers tuning.

It was an issue for alistar because he bought a sheen, so Sheen-AA adds +200% base ad to the damage of a 10 second cd ability. Even Lee's ult doesn't have that (it's bonus AD. Granted its base is insane and it scales with enemy hp too).

That bears repeating: with sheen, Alistar's headbutt had an effective 200% TOTAL AD SCALING on a 10 SECOND COOLDOWN, on a 625 RANGE ability.

---

All this aside, it's gone over most people's heads that I actually do think this ability should be removed. However, the reason is because I think it doesn't make thematic sense that you can punch someone after you kick them away, and because it makes Lee's skill floor a little bit higher, which means he's easier to balance for both high and low elo.

But I do think the reasons behind the change are important, and saying "We should do it to Lee because we did it to Alistar" is not a good enough reason in my book.
